j2k

Class ImageInput

  • java.lang.Object
    • j2k.ImageInput

  • public class ImageInput
extends java.lang.Object
    This class handles the image input and control of the reader and decompressor
    Since:
    14/02/2013
    Author:
    Dylan McCarthy

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ImageInput()
      The ImageInput class defines the input source for an image, it handles the management of the communication, cache and rendering of the image.

      • open

        public void open(java.lang.String fname)
          throws java.lang.Exception
        Open a new image The path name is passed to the JPIP Reader then the Reader is used to create the codestream. The codestream is then configured and the base values for the dimensions are set. Further information about the codestream is printed to the programs console.
        Parameters:
        fname - Path to image, usually in the format JPIP://server.com/imagename.jpx
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • startDecoding

        public void startDecoding(ImageView newView)
        Start decoding the image
        Parameters:
        newView - ImageView that defines the current ROI that is being rendered
